summary: Havana, the capital of Cuba, is the country's biggest city and main port. Founded by the Spanish in the 16th century, it's now a major tourist attraction with over a million visitors each year. The city is divided into three main parts: Old Havana (a UNESCO World Heritage Site), Vedado, and the suburban districts. Havana has a rich history, beautiful architecture, and a vibrant culture. It's also the seat of the Cuban government and home to many businesses and diplomatic offices.
title: Havana
